intro: Croton cuyabensis, commonly known as the Cuyabén croton, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to South America, specifically found in regions of Peru and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage, which can range from green to red and yellow. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, often in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
